Nil Check.description:
Description

Introduction

A Nil Check is a type check. Failures of Nil Check violate the
"tell, don't ask" principle.
Additionally to that, type checks often mask bigger problems in your source
code like not using OOP and / or polymorphism when you should.

The Nil Check code smell is a case of Simulated Polymorphism.

Example

Given

ruby
class Klass
  def nil_checker(argument)
    if argument.nil?
      puts "argument is nil!"
    end
  end
end

Reek would emit the following warning:

test.rb -- 1 warning:
  [3]:Klass#nil_checker performs a nil-check. (NilCheck)

Current Support in Reek

Nil Check reports use of

.nil? method
== and === operators when checking vs. nil
case statements that use syntax like when nil

Nil Check allows use of

the safe navigation operator like foo&.bar
